original_solution_mapping.L1: First, subtract the number of days Jenna can't read from the number of days in September: 30 days - 4 days = <<30-4=26>>26 days.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Then subtract the one day when Jenna will read 100 pages: 26 days - 1 day = <<26-1=25>>25 days.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Now subtract the 100 pages Jenna will read on her flight from her overall goal: 600 pages - 100 pages = <<600-100=500>>500 pages.
original_solution_mapping.L4: Finally, divide that number of pages by the number of days Jenna will read the standard amount: 500 pages / 25 days = <<500/25=20>>20 pages per day.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6767.
    Returns: the number of pages Jenna needs to read per day.
    """
    # L1
    days_in_september = 30 # September (which has 30 days)
    days_cant_read = 4 # four weekdays starting on the 13th, so she won't have time to read
    reading_days_after_busy_period = days_in_september - days_cant_read

    # L2
    flight_day_count = 1 # 100 pages on the 23rd
    remaining_reading_days = reading_days_after_busy_period - flight_day_count

    # L3
    overall_goal_pages = 600 # goal of reading 600 pages a month
    pages_on_flight = 100 # read 100 pages on the 23rd
    pages_remaining_after_flight = overall_goal_pages - pages_on_flight

    # L4
    pages_per_day = pages_remaining_after_flight / remaining_reading_days

    # FA
    answer = pages_per_day
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: First, subtract the number of days Jenna can't read from the number of days in September: {days_in_september} days - {days_cant_read} days = <<{days_in_september}-{days_cant_read}={reading_days_after_busy_period}>>{reading_days_after_busy_period} days.

Then subtract the one day when Jenna will read 100 pages: {reading_days_after_busy_period} days - {flight_day_count} day = <<{reading_days_after_busy_period}-{flight_day_count}={remaining_reading_days}>>{remaining_reading_days} days.

Now subtract the {pages_on_flight} pages Jenna will read on her flight from her overall goal: {overall_goal_pages} pages - {pages_on_flight} pages = <<{overall_goal_pages}-{pages_on_flight}={pages_remaining_after_flight}>>{pages_remaining_after_flight} pages.

Finally, divide that number of pages by the number of days Jenna will read the standard amount: {pages_remaining_after_flight} pages / {remaining_reading_days} days = <<{pages_remaining_after_flight}/{remaining_reading_days}={pages_per_day}>>{pages_per_day} pages per day.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: First, subtract the number of days Jenna can't read from the number of days in September: 30 days - 4 days = <<30-4=26>>26 days.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Then subtract the one day when Jenna will read 100 pages: 26 days - 1 day = <<26-1=25>>25 days.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Now subtract the 100 pages Jenna will read on her flight from her overall goal: 600 pages - 100 pages = <<600-100=500>>500 pages.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: Finally, divide that number of pages by the number of days Jenna will read the standard amount: 500 pages / 4 days = <<500/4=125>>125 pages per day.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'days_cant_read' (value: 4) was used instead of 'remaining_reading_days' (value: 25).
